Hi! My Name is Bill Huang

And I'm a Developer!

Who am I?

My name is Bill Huang...


I was raised in the wintery city of Calgary, Alberta. In 2013, I left my hometown for Waterloo, Ontario in order to pursue an undergraduate degree in Electrical Engineering. I have always possessed an interest for technology and this degree allows me to sate my curiosity.

If you have any questions or concerns, I can be reached through email at any time.

Skill Set

Languages

C#, C++, Python, Assembly, Java, HTML5/CSS (Bootstrap), JavaScript (jQuery, AngularJS), XML, SQL

Operating Systems

Windows, Android, Mac, Linux

HardWare

Oscilloscope, Function Generator, Digital Multimeter, Breadboards, ARM board, FPGA board

Development Tools

Visual Studio, Linux Terminal/SSH, Unity 3D, Android Studio, MultiSim, MatLab, Git, Microsoft Office, Photoshop, μVision4

Work Experience

I am a second year Electrical Engineering student at the University of Waterloo. The Co-op program that is implemented here gives me the opportunity to explore the potential of my degree. This page will be updated regularly as I become a part of more projects and obtain exposure to different fields. In the next year, my goal is to become involved in a game development team and gain more experience with in the field of programming. I am proficient in Java, JavaScript, Python, C#, HTML, CSS, and VHDL.

nanoPay

May 2015 - August 2015Toronto, Ontario

nanoPay is a relatively new startup company that streamlines checkout and creates a smoother shopping experiences by delivering loyalty, coupons and payment with a single touch. I have had the pleasure to work for nanoPay as a Front End Developer, spending my time creating the loyalty portal that the clients of nanoPay will use. Here, I gained significant experience in development using AngularJS and also the Agile Software Development Cycle.

Kearl Expansion Project / PCL Intracon

September 2014 - December 2014Fort McMurray, Alberta

The Kearl Expansion Project is an oil sands mine in the Athabasca Oil Sands Region in northern Alberta. I feel lucky to have played a part in both the construction portion as well as the quality control portion for the Electrical Heat Trace of this project. Here I learned more about the turnover to client process as I have worked at Kearl to it's completion in terms of EHT.

Conoco Phillips Surmont Phase II / PCL Intracon

Janurary 2014 - April 2014Fort McMurray, Alberta

I have had the pleasure to have been apart of the team that is currently constructing the worlds largest Steam-assisted gravity drainage (or SAGD) facility in the world. Here, I gained extensive knowledge and experience with regards to Project Coordination and Project planning.

Alberta Heath Services

June 2012 - August 2012Calgary, Alberta

I spent the summer of 2012 working for Alberta Health Services as a dietician intern. A fellow intern and I lead a research project on celiac disease as well as working on a celiac disease support group.

Projects

I have a very hands on learning style. Whenever I learn something new, I just have to apply my knowledge and create something that I can phyiscally see or use. I also see it as an effective method of solidifying my knowledge. I am always looking for new ways to improve my projects and will do so whenever I learn something cool and exciting. This applies for any of the projects that I have worked on. You can find some of the stuff I have created down below, it will be regularly updated as I learn more new and exciting things!

  • All
  • Web Design
  • Android Application
  • Hardware
  • Game Design
Android Pedometer

Designed and gimplemented Android Pedometer using finite state machines and sensor event handlers. Contains map loading and path finding capabilities.

Morse Code Translator

Takes in string inputs and outputs morse signals. Programmed using an ARM board and assembly language.

TapExchange

TapExchange is a simple user-friendly android application that allows you to easily exchange contact information with your friends by tapping your phones together.

Traffic Light System

Designed and programmed a 4-way traffic light system on a FPGA board using VHDL programming language

HexCode Detector

This Android Application will prompt a user to take or upload a picture and return the Hex value of the most common color within the selected area.

Website Design
Rainbow Run

Simple infinite 2D side scroller created using the 2D functions in Unity3D.

Flappy Bird Clone

My take on the classic Flappy Bird Game that took the world by storm. Utilizes the same sprites with even more messed up physics.

Pong

A Recreation of the classic game of Pong.
